channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netanyahu Unwavering on Cease-Fire, and Putin Visits Mongolia
Two U.S. Marines Attacked in Turkey by Nationalist Youth Group
item.description: Turkish officials said they had detained 15 members of the group. The two servicemen had returned to the ship and were safe, U.S. officials said.

item.title: Don’t Flip Out Over Election Forecasts
item.description: Election forecasters and their predictive models in the presidential race are in the spotlight. Here’s how to understand this work better.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: As Israel’s Rifts Widen, Netanyahu Remains Defiant
item.description: In strikes and protests, many Israelis are pushing their government to prioritize the release of hostages above the immediate defeat of Hamas. Prime M...

item.title: Vance Championed 2017 Report on Families From Architects of Project 2025
item.description: JD Vance, as he was dipping his toe into politics, praised the Heritage Foundation report — 29 essays opposing abortion and seeking to instruct Americ...

item.title: Dozens of Hostages Are Still in Gaza: What We Know
item.description: More than 60 living hostages, and the bodies of about 35 others taken captive on Oct. 7, are still in Gaza, the Israeli authorities say.

item.title: James Carville: Three Things Kamala Harris Must Do to Win
item.description: She has to help Trump hurt himself in the debate, break with Biden on policy and show how she has grown since the 2020 campaign.

item.title: Eden Yerushalmi, an Israeli Hostage Killed in Gaza, Is Seen in Hamas Video
item.description: Ms. Yerushalmi, 24, was one of six captives whose bodies the Israeli military recovered from Gaza over the weekend. It was not clear when the video wa...

item.title: Activists Charged With Pushing Russian Propaganda Go on Trial in Florida
item.description: Experts say the case offers a window into how the Russian government tries to influence American elections and promote its own geopolitical agenda.

item.title: Putin Begins Meetings in Mongolia in Defiance of I.C.C. Arrest Warrant
item.description: The Russian president is making a state visit to a country that is heavily dependent on Moscow for oil.
